primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: An intensive basic course in spoken and written French for students who have no knowledge of French: comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing.
cmCourseInfo.title: Elementary French I
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: FSL102H1, FSL120H1, FSL121Y1, FSL122H1, FSL 200+ level courses

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

This is a 6-hour course (4-hr lecture, 2-hr tutorial). Students will be assigned a tutorial by the instructor at the beginning of classes. Students with NO previous knowledge of French (eg. no elementary nor high school French) will enroll in this course and are NOT required to do the online placement test.

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: An intensive basic course in spoken and written French for students who have studied some French, but who have not yet attained the entry level for FSL120H1.
cmCourseInfo.title: Elementary French II
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: FSL100H1. Students may also fulfill this prerequisite requirement based on the results of their French Placement Test.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

This is a 6-hour course (4-hr lecture, 2-hr tutorial). Students will be assigned a tutorial by the instructor at the beginning of classes.  The placement test https://uttf.artsci.utoronto.ca/login is mandatory for students with a minimum knowledge of French.

subjectPost.name: French Language and French Linguistics Major
French Language and French Linguistics Specialist

cmCourseInfo.description: This is the first of a two-course series intended for students having some knowledge of French but wishing to increase their proficiency to that of normal University entrance. Offers training in written and spoken French; reinforcement of reading comprehension and aural abilities; and an introduction to French-Canadian and Québécois cultures.
cmCourseInfo.title: Elementary French III
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: FSL102H1. Students may also fulfill this prerequisite requirement based on the results of their French Placement Test.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

NOTE: As of 2022-23, the following FSL courses have been divided into two half equivalents:  

FSL121Y1=FSL120H1 + FSL122H1

FSL221Y1=FSL220H1 + FSL222H1

FSL321Y1=FSL320H1 + FSL322H1

FSL421Y1=FSL420H1 + a FRE course

Program requirements will now accept both the original courses (no longer offered) and these new equivalents.

This is a 8-hour course (4-hr lecture, 4-hr tutorial). Students will be assigned a tutorial by the instructor at the beginning of classes. If this is your first French course at U of T and if you have any previous experience in French (including elementary or high school French), you must first take the French Placement Test at: https://uttf.artsci.utoronto.ca/login.

Please note that Tutorials are included in the scheduled course times.

subjectPost.name: French Language and French Linguistics Major
French Language and French Linguistics Specialist

cmCourseInfo.description: This is the first of a two-course series intended for those who have some knowledge of French, this course is the first in a proficiency-sequenced series that provides students with the opportunity to become proficient, focused, autonomous French language learners. The course’s main objective is to provide a communicative learning environment through activities based in real-world, everyday contexts.
cmCourseInfo.title: Intermediate French I
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: FSL121Y1/FSL122H1. Students may also fulfill this prerequisite requirement based on the results of their French Placement Test.
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: FSL221Y1, FSL222H1, FSL224H1, FSL225H1, FSL226H1, FSL271H1, FSL 300+ level courses

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

NOTE: As of 2022-23, the following FSL courses have been divided into two half equivalents: 

FSL121Y1=FSL120H1 + FSL122H1

FSL221Y1=FSL220H1 + FSL222H1

FSL321Y1=FSL320H1 + FSL322H1

FSL421Y1=FSL420H1 + a FRE course

Program requirements will now accept both the original courses (no longer offered) and these new equivalents.

If this is your first French course at U of T and if you have any previous experience in French (including elementary or high school French), you must first take the French Placement Test at: https://www.french.utoronto.ca/prospective-undergraduate-students/placement-test 

This is a 8-hour course (4-hr lecture, 2-hr tutorial, 2-hr asynchronous activities). All students must enroll in both the lecture and the tutorial for a total of eight hours per week.

Students should check for any schedule conflict before enrolling in a tutorial. Changing or switching of lecture meeting or tutorial at mid-session is not permitted at the Department of French. Students who are not enrolled in the tutorial of their choice by the enrolment deadline will be placed by the Department of French in another section according to availability

subjectPost.name: French Language and French Linguistics Major
French Language and French Linguistics Specialist

cmCourseInfo.description: This is the second of a two-course series intended for those who have some knowledge of French, this course is the first in a proficiency-sequenced series that provides students with the opportunity to become proficient, focused, autonomous French language learners. The course’s main objective is to provide a communicative learning environment through activities based in real-world, everyday contexts.
cmCourseInfo.title: Intermediate French II
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: FSL220H1. Students may also fulfill this prerequisite requirement based on the results of their French Placement Test.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

NOTE: As of 2022-23, the following FSL courses have been divided into two half equivalents: 

FSL121Y1=FSL120H1 + FSL122H1

FSL221Y1=FSL220H1 + FSL222H1

FSL321Y1=FSL320H1 + FSL322H1

FSL421Y1=FSL420H1 + a FRE course

Program requirements will now accept both the original courses (no longer offered) and these new equivalents.

If this is your first French course at U of T and if you have any previous experience in French (including elementary or high school French), you must first take the French Placement Test at: https://www.french.utoronto.ca/prospective-undergraduate-students/placement-test 

This is a 8-hour course (4-hr lecture, 12-hr tutorial, 2-hr asynchronous activities). All students must enroll in both the lecture and the tutorial for a total of eight hours per week.

Students should check for any schedule conflict before enrolling in a tutorial. Changing or switching of lecture meeting or tutorial at mid-session is not permitted at the Department of French. Students who are not enrolled in the tutorial of their choice by the enrolment deadline will be placed by the Department of French in another section according to availability.

subjectPost.name: French Language and French Linguistics Major
French Language and French Linguistics Specialist

cmCourseInfo.description: This course is designed to present students with the practical skills, grammatical knowledge and metalinguistic awareness needed to engage with introductory French linguistics courses. Students will hone higher-order analytical skills related to French language and linguistics through comprehension and production exercises and activities. A variety of textual excerpts selected from several subfields of linguistics will allow exposure to the basic elements of French linguistics through which students will develop awareness and comfort with academic writing and academic discourse in French. Emphasis is on the appropriate use of formal registers, terminology, incorporation of logical connectors and analytical thinking in written and spoken French.
cmCourseInfo.title: Practical French for Exploring Linguistics
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: FSL220H1. Students may also fulfill this prerequisite requirement based on the results of their French Placement Test.
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: FSL312H1, FSL313H1, FSL314H1, FSL315H1, FSL322H1, FSL375Y1, FSL375H1, FSL 400-level courses.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

If this is your first French course at U of T and if you have any previous experience in French (including elementary or high school French), you must first take the French Placement Test at: https://www.french.utoronto.ca/prospective-undergraduate-students/placement-test

subjectPost.name: French Language and French Linguistics Major
French Language and French Linguistics Specialist

cmCourseInfo.description: This course is designed to present students with the practical skills, grammatical knowledge and metalinguistic awareness needed to engage with introductory French literature courses. Students will hone higher-order analytical skills related to French language and literature through comprehension and production exercises and activities. A variety of textual excerpts selected from geographically diverse essays, poetry and novels will allow exposure to the basic elements of French literary analysis through which students will develop awareness and comfort with academic writing and academic discourse in French. Emphasis is on the appropriate use of formal registers, terminology, incorporation of logical connectors and analytical thinking in written and spoken French.
cmCourseInfo.title: Practical French for Exploring Literature
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: FSL220H1. Students may also fulfill this prerequisite requirement based on the results of their French Placement Test.
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: FSL312H1, FSL313H1, FSL314H1, FSL315H1, FSL322H1, FSL375Y1, FSL375H1, FSL 400-level courses.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

If this is your first French course at U of T and if you have any previous experience in French (including elementary or high school French), you must first take the French Placement Test at: https://www.french.utoronto.ca/prospective-undergraduate-students/placement-test

cmCourseInfo.description: This advanced course in French aims to provide students with a broader understanding and appreciation of French and Francophone culture through the reading and discussion of a variety of texts. Emphasis is placed on mastery of language skills such as reading comprehension and vocabulary, oral and written communication. Students will have access to multimedia materials, online reference and self-correction tools.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced French I
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: FSL321Y1/FSL322H1. Students may also fulfill this prerequisite requirement based on the results of their French Placement Test.
